So Spark New Zealand is the
largest telecommunications

and digital service
provider in New Zealand.

During a recent survey
that the Spark Group did,
around 88% of New Zealand companies

are really interested in
moving into public cloud.
However, around 30% of those companies
are really tentative about cloud use
because of the skills gap
and expertise shortage in New Zealand.
We worked with AWS Skills Guild

to stand up a program at Spark
called Spark Cloud Academy.
It's allowed us to bring together

a number of different learning
opportunities for people.

So we've worked with AWS
instructor-led training

to do tech essentials
architecture development
and systems operations training,
and followed that up with certifications
for a number of our staff.
We've really seen a huge benefit in this,
just in the language being used at Spark
and the common knowledge and understanding
that we've had across the team.

We were able to sit down
with AWS Skills Guild
and tailor the training.

AWS came in with a whole lot
of best practice information
about how to approach training,

having done this with a number
of organizations globally.
While we're able to take AWS's training,

we're also able to
personalize it for our company
and tailor it to our company's culture.

Everybody learns in different
ways and at their own pace,
and we're really keen to make sure

that we're providing a
lot of different ways
for people to be able to get the knowledge

and information that AWS
Skills Guild provides.
